item.title: 早间竞标：三次会议结束，剩下的会议开始
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 聚焦：腾讯的下一个升级： 减少国外大型特许经营游戏，增加自研游戏
item.description: 在中国腾讯公司发生的一场巨变中，一款简单易玩的可爱角色闯关游戏，已经取代了为智能手机开发大制作的外国特许经营游戏。【原文：In a sea change at China's Tencent , an easy-to-play game of cute characters tackling obstacle courses has taken precedence over developing a big-budget sophisticated foreign franchise for smartphones.】

item.title: 新规提高门槛，中国消费贷款机构将面临洗牌
item.description: 中国收紧了对消费金融公司的规定，这很可能会迫使这个市值约 1200 亿美元的行业进行整合，因为该行业为数百万被传统银行拒之门外的人提供高息贷款。【原文：China's tightening of rules for consumer finance companies is likely to force consolidation in the roughly $120 billion sector that provides high-interest loans for millions of people shut out of traditional banking.】

item.title: 美国正在加快股票结算速度，其他国家呢？
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会于 2023 年 2 月通过了一项规则，从 2024 年 5 月 28 日开始，将证券交易的结算周期从交易后两个工作日缩短为一个工作日。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission adopted a rule in February 2023 to shorten the settlement cycle for securities transactions from two business days after the trade to one, beginning on May 28, 2024.】

item.title: 聚焦：迫在眉睫的美股变动可能让国际基金头疼不已
item.description: 迫在眉睫的美国证券结算周期缩短令国际基金经理头疼不已，他们面临着人员配备问题、持有更多现金的前景以及外汇风险上升等问题。【原文：The looming introduction of a shorter settlement cycle for U.S. securities is causing headaches for international fund managers, who face staffing problems, the prospect of holding more cash and raised foreign exchange risk as they prepare to comply.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴前首席执行官张朝阳将加入 Firstred Capital 担任管理合伙人
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团前首席执行官丹尼尔-张（Daniel Zhang）离开中国电子商务巨头阿里巴巴六个月后，第一资本（Firstred Capital）周四表示，丹尼尔-张将加入第一资本，担任管理合伙人。【原文：Alibaba Group's former CEO Daniel Zhang will join Firstred Capital as managing partner, Firstred Capital said on Thursday, six months after he left the Chinese e-commerce giant.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，人工智能初创公司 Cohere 在最新一次融资中寻求 50 亿美元的估值
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，开发基础模型以与 ChatGPT 创造者 OpenAI 竞争的人工智能初创公司 Cohere 正在进行融资 5 亿美元的高级谈判，估值约为 50 亿美元。【原文：Cohere, an artificial intelligence startup that develops foundation models to compete with ChatGPT creator OpenAI, is in advanced talks to raise $500 million at a valuation of about $5 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国央行副行长称仍有进一步下调银行准备金率的空间
item.description: 中国央行副行长周四表示，中国有足够的货币政策空间来进一步下调银行存款准备金率，这凸显了市场对中国将采取更多宽松措施来刺激经济的预期。【原文：The deputy governor of China's central bank said on Thursday there is ample monetary policy room to deliver further cuts to banks' reserve requirement ratio (RRR), underlining market expectations for more easing measures to bolster the economy.】

item.title: 报告称新西兰个人银行服务竞争有限
item.description: 新西兰竞争监督机构周四表示，由于采取了价格匹配策略以及缺乏推动变革的破坏性力量，新西兰四大银行在个人银行服务方面的竞争十分有限。【原文：New Zealand's four major banks provide limited competition for personal banking services due to price-matching strategies and a lack of disruptive forces to drive change, the country's competition watchdog said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国坚持降息计划，亚洲股市跳涨
item.description: 周四，在美国联邦储备委员会表示将坚持减息计划后，亚洲股市反弹，金价和日本日经指数跃升至历史新高。【原文：Asian shares bounced while gold prices and Japan's Nikkei jumped to record highs on Thursday after the U.S. Federal Reserve indicated it would stick with plans for cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 美国原油和汽油库存下降为石油提供一定支撑，石油反弹
item.description: 油价在前一交易日下跌后于周四反弹，原因是美国原油和汽油库存下降支撑了市场，此前有迹象表明美国联邦储备委员会可能在更长时间内维持更高的利率，这压制了未来燃料需求的前景。【原文：Oil prices rebounded on Thursday after falling in the previous session as U.S. crude and gasoline inventory declines supported the market after signs the U.S. Federal Reserve may keep rates higher for longer crimped the outlook for future fuel demand.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 2 月失业率下降，就业率回升
item.description: 澳大利亚 2 月份就业大幅反弹，失业率大幅下降，远远低于预期，这有力地表明劳动力市场仍然紧张，近期的疲软在统计上被夸大了。【原文：Australian employment rebounded sharply in February, while the jobless rate dived far below forecasts in an emphatic sign the labour market was still tight and that recent weakness had been statistically overstated.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Shein 将向全球品牌推广供应链基础设施
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引执行主席唐纳德-唐致投资者的一封信报道，由中国创办的快速时尚公司Shein将向全球品牌提供其供应链基础设施和技术。【原文：China-founded fast-fashion company Shein will make its supply-chain infrastructure and technology available to global brands, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing a letter to investors from Executive Chairman Donald Tang.】

item.title: 日本央行行长誓言保持货币刺激政策，并对物价上涨势头表示肯定
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）周四誓言继续以超宽松货币政策支持经济，但表示相信通胀势头正在增强，市场正在寻找下一次加息时机的线索。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda on Thursday vowed to keep supporting the economy with ultra-loose monetary policy but signalled confidence inflation was gaining momentum, as markets look for clues on the next interest rate hike timing.】

item.title: 美联储维持不变，美元下滑；就业数据利好澳元，澳元跳涨
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会在通胀出现上行意外的情况下维持了今年的降息预期，并且没有像一些投资者担心的那样采取更加鹰派的基调，美元在周四普遍下跌。【原文：The dollar fell broadly on Thursday after the U.S. Federal Reserve maintained its interest rate cut projections for the year in the face of upside surprises on inflation, and did not strike a more hawkish tone as some investors had feared.】

item.title: 主要市场需求改善，日本出口增长
item.description: 2 月份，日本出口连续第三个月增长，美国、中国和欧盟的需求有所改善，这为去年经济表现疲软后寻求恢复增长的政策制定者带来了一些希望。【原文：Japan's exports grew for a third straight month in February demand improved in the U.S., China and the European Union, offering some hope for policymakers seeking to revive growth after weak performance last year.】

item.title: 日本工厂活动降幅放缓，服务业回暖
item.description: 周四的一项商业调查显示，日本 3 月份的工厂活动萎缩速度放缓，而服务业的进一步扩张支撑了私营部门的整体增长。【原文：Japan's factory activity shrank at a slower pace in March, while further expansion in the service sector supported overall growth in the private sector, a business survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局迁移新泽西州纽瓦克空域控制权以减少拥堵
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局周三表示，将把新泽西州纽瓦克空域的控制权转移到费城，以解决纽约市地区的人员配置问题和交通拥堵问题。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday it will relocate control of the Newark, New Jersey, airspace area to Philadelphia to address staffing issues and congested traffic in the New York City area.】

item.title: 纽约市广播公司披露三月份董事会有两人离职
item.description: 陷入困境的纽约社区银行在周三提交的一份文件中说，该公司的两名董事劳伦斯-萨瓦雷兹（Lawrence Savarese）和戴维-特雷德韦尔（David Treadwell）已于 3 月份从董事会辞职。【原文：Two New York Community Bancorp directors, Lawrence Savarese and David Treadwell, resigned from the board in March, the embattled lender said in a filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔在预测变化中强调长期前景的不确定性
item.description: 美联储官员周三上调了长期目标利率的预期水平，但央行主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，这并不一定预示着利率将持续走高。【原文：Federal Reserve officials on Wednesday nudged up the level estimated for their target interest rate over the longer term, but central bank Chair Jerome Powell said that does not necessarily herald an era of consistently higher interest rates.】

item.title: 早间竞价：鲍威尔加持，日元仍岌岌可危
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 加密货币行业调查美国 2024 候选人，寻找友好的立法者
item.description: 加密货币行业是 2024 年美国大选周期中一股新的金融力量，该行业正在调查国会议员候选人对数字资产的看法，因为该运动的政治分支又获得了数以万计的追随者，并增加了其战力。【原文：The cryptocurrency industry, a new financial force in the 2024 U.S. election cycle, is surveying candidates for Congress on their views around the digital asset, as the political arm of the movement gains tens of thousands more followers and adds to its war chest.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，美国司法部将起诉苹果公司违反反垄断法
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，美国司法部准备最快于周四起诉苹果公司，指控其阻止竞争对手访问其 iPhone 的硬件和软件功能，从而违反了反垄断法。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice is poised to sue Apple as soon as Thursday for allegedly violating antitrust laws by blocking rivals from accessing hardware and software features of its iPhone, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: Reddit 首次公开募股（IPO）定价为标明区间的最高价，拟筹资 7.48 亿美元
item.description: 社交媒体平台 Reddit 周三以每股 31 美元至 34 美元目标区间的最高价进行了首次公开募股，募集资金 7.48 亿美元，为萎靡不振的技术 IPO 市场注入了急需的活力。【原文：Social media platform Reddit priced its initial public offering at the top of its targeted range of $31 to $34 per share on Wednesday, raising $748 million and giving the ailing technology IPO market a much-needed boost.】

item.title: 墨西哥总体通胀率可能在 3 月初反弹
item.description: 路透社周三的一项民意调查显示，墨西哥的总体通胀率可能在 3 月上半月加速上升，这支持了这样的押注：虽然墨西哥央行可能在本周下调其关键利率，但它不会启动一个激进的宽松周期。【原文：Mexican headline inflation likely accelerated in the first half of March, a Reuters poll showed on Wednesday, supporting bets that while the central bank may cut its key interest rate this week, it will not start an aggressive easing cycle.】

item.title: 壳牌向 Ocean Winds North America 出售在 SouthCoast Wind Energy 的股份
item.description: 能源公司壳牌（Shell）周三表示，已将其持有的南海岸风能公司（SouthCoast Wind Energy）50%的股份出售给其合资伙伴 Ocean Winds North America，出售价格未公开。【原文：Energy firm Shell said on Wednesday it had sold its 50% stake in SouthCoast Wind Energy, established to develop wind projects off the coast of Massachusetts, to its joint venture partner Ocean Winds North America for an undisclosed sum.】

item.title: Meta、微软、X 和 Match 加入 Epic Games 与苹果的战斗
item.description: Meta Platforms、微软、埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司和 Match Group 周三加入了《堡垒之夜》视频游戏制造商 Epic Games 的行列，抗议苹果公司未能履行法院下达的禁令，在其利润丰厚的 App Store 中进行支付。【原文：Meta Platforms , Microsoft , Elon Musk's X and Match Group on Wednesday joined "Fortnite" video game maker Epic Games' protest that Apple has failed to honor a court-ordered injunction governing payments in its lucrative App Store.】

item.title: 英特尔最新获得美国芯片资金，计划获得更多赠款和贷款
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp）周三成为最新一家获得美国政府数十亿美元赠款和贷款的半导体公司，这是乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统为提高国内芯片产量而做出的努力。【原文：Intel Corp on Wednesday was the latest semiconductor company to be awarded billions of dollars in grants and loans from the U.S. government in President Joe Biden's effort to supercharge domestic chip output.】

item.title: 据美国全国广播公司（NBC）报道，美国联邦通信委员会正在调查亚马逊涉嫌销售非法产品一事
item.description: 据 NBC 新闻周三报道，美国联邦通信委员会正在调查亚马逊和其他零售商涉嫌营销和销售非法电子设备的行为，其中包括无线电频率干扰器。【原文：The U.S. Federal Communications Commission is investigating Amazon and other retailers for the alleged marketing and selling of unlawful electronic devices, including radio frequency jammers, NBC News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔表示即将缩减资产负债表
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周三表示，央行放缓资产负债表缩减步伐的日子正在迅速临近。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday the day is swiftly approaching when the central bank will slow the pace of its balance sheet run off, and in moving toward a taper of the drawdown, it may allow the central bank to ultimately shed more bonds than it once expected.】
